Media.MediaTitle: radiation therapy, external beam (EBRT), head and neck

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Made the black crosses on the tape closer to the size of the tape so they aren’t on the mesh; Added a black cross to the piece of tape on the side of the head in the main image

Changed the red crosses on the white tape pieces to black; added a cross to the piece of tape on the side of the person’s head; removed the pieces of tape on the neck and front of the person's chest on both the inset and the main figure; and made the drape on the inset match the blue drape on the main figure.
Removed red marking from tape on side of face
Moved the person so the neck and shoulders are more inside the machine; make the mask on the main figure look more like mesh; made the person African-American.

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: External-beam radiation therapy of the head and neck; drawing shows a patient lying on a table under a machine that is used to aim high-energy radiation at the cancer. An inset shows a mesh mask that helps keep the patient's head and neck from moving during treatment. The mask has pieces of white tape with small ink marks on it. The ink marks are used to line up the radiation machine in the same position before each treatment.

Captions.MediaCaption: External-beam radiation therapy of the head and neck. A machine is used to aim high-energy radiation at the cancer. The machine can rotate around the patient, delivering radiation from many different angles to provide highly conformal treatment. A mesh mask helps keep the patient’s head and neck from moving during treatment. Small ink marks are put on the mask. The ink marks are used to line up the radiation machine in the same position before each treatment.

ProcessingStatus.ProcessingStatusValue: Approved by expert reviewer with changes
ProcessingStatus.Comment: Minor edits made to caption per reviewer
